Container.Name: swag
Container.Overview:
SWAG - Secure Web Application Gateway is a rebirth of our letsencrypt docker image, a full fledged web server and reverse proxy that includes Nginx, Php7, Certbot (Let's Encrypt client) and Fail2ban.
Before running this container, make sure that the url and subdomains are properly forwarded to this container's host.
- Port 443 on the internet side of the router should be forwarded to this container's port 443. - If you need a dynamic dns provider, you can use the free provider duckdns.org where the url will be yoursubdomain.duckdns.org and the subdomains can be "www,ftp,cloud," or "wildcard" if using duckdns validation - The container detects changes to url and subdomains, revokes existing certs and generates new ones during start.
- If you'd like to password protect your sites, you can use htpasswd. Run the following command on your host to generate the htpasswd file docker exec -it swag htpasswd -c /config/nginx/.htpasswd <username>
Container.Description: SWAG is an nginx webserver and reverse proxy with php support and a built-in Certbot (Let's Encrypt) client. It also contains fail2ban for intrusion prevention.

Config.Name: Email
Config.Description: Your e-mail address for cert registration

Config.Name: Domain Name
Config.Description: the top url you have control over customdomain.com if you own it, or customsubdomain.ddnsprovider.com if using dynamic dns)

Config.Name: Subdomain(s)
Config.Description: Subdomains you'd like the cert to cover (comma separated, no spaces) ie. www,ftp,cloud,

Config.Name: Only Subdomains
Config.Description: if you wish to get certs only for certain subdomains, but not the main domain (main domain may be hosted on another machine and cannot be validated), set this to true

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: UID for permissions. Do not change unless you know what you're doing.

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: GID for permissions. Do not change unless you know what you're doing.

Config.Name: Validation
Config.Description: Flag to specify validation method use either 'http','dns' or 'tls-sni'

Config.Name: DNS-Plugin
Config.Description: DNS plugin to use if using DNS validation

Config.Name: Extra Domains
Config.Description: Additional domains/subdomains you'd like the cert to cover (comma separated, no spaces) ie. domain2.com,*.domain2.com

Config.Name: Staging
Config.Description: When set to true, it significantly increases Let's Encrypt throttle thresholds, but produces non-validated certs, ideal for testing validation changes

Config.Name: DuckDNS Token
Config.Description: If using duckdns validation, enter the DuckDNS token here

Config.Name: Propagation
Config.Description: Optionally override (in seconds) the default propagation time for the dns plugins
